name: "ESPN: NFL 2K5" Trivia Game | Video Games | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Sega.

	Sega exited the hardware business, and started making software in early 2000, after the Dreamcast failed to make a profit.

Owens & Terrell Owens.

	Owens was traded from San Fransisco to Baltimore, then to Philadelphia over the offseason.

questions.text: This game originally retailed for a price much different than most games debut at. What price did it debut at? (Round to the nearest dollar)
questions.explanation:
$20.

	To sell more copies, Sega began releasing all of its sports titles at $20 in 2004.

questions.text: Which sportscaster hosts Sportscenter for all of the in-game highlights?
questions.explanation:
Chris Berman.

	Berman is the only one that is actually a Sportscenter anchor. Dennis Scott and Lance Berkman are both athletes and Marv Alberts is a play-by-play announcer.

True.

	Every sports game that ESPN had ever released, as of 2004, has had an "E" or everybody rating.

questions.text: How many players can play in one game?
questions.explanation:
16.

	Up to 16 players can play together online. Up to four without an internet connection.

questions.text: Can this game be played online?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	With the use of the broadband adapter this game can be played over the net allowing up to 16 players at a time to participate.

questions.text: How many different game modes can be played?
questions.explanation:
7.

	The modes include; Franchise, First Person Football, Practice, Situation, Tournament, Online, and ESPN 25th Aniversaery. This game has the most comprehensive franchise mode of any football game out that year.

questions.text: This was the ________ ESPN football game on the PS2.
questions.explanation:
Third.

	This was the third year that Sega has released an ESPN title on the PS2. Sega began releasing titles for other consoles after the Dreamcast failed to make them a profit. Sega had become the "worldwide leader in sports" video games, to borrow the phrase from ESPN.

questions.text: Roy Williams and Joey Harrington are my teams top players. What is my VIP profile's favorite team?
questions.explanation:
Detroit Lions.

	Williams was a rookie in 2004, Harrington was in his 3rd season. Together they helped the Lions to end their 22 game road losing streak during a week 1 win over the Bears in Chicago. The Lions started the season 2-0 on the road before falling to the Cowboys in week seven.
